pr_title: Issue #13663: EJB Persistent Timer feature for Jakarta

timeline.bodyText: Should we still be using Enterprise JavaBeans here in the description?
timeline.author: brideck
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,17 @@
+###############################################################################
+# Copyright (c) 2015 IBM Corporation and others.
+# All rights reserved. This program and the accompanying materials
+# are made available under the terms of the Eclipse Public License v1.0
+# which accompanies this distribution, and is available at
+# http://www.eclipse.org/legal/epl-v10.html
+#
+# Contributors:
+#     IBM Corporation - initial API and implementation
+###############################################################################
+#
+#ISMESSAGEFILE FALSE
+#NLS_ENCODING=UNICODE
+#NLS_MESSAGEFORMAT_NONE
+#
+
+description=This feature enables the use of persistent timers in Enterprise JavaBeans.

replies.bodyText: @brideck  Nice catch; thanks.  I've updated all the translations to use Jakarta Enterprise Beans and also fixed the copyright.
replies.author: tkburroughs

timeline.message:
Issue #13663: EJB Persistent Timer feature for Jakarta

Add enterpriseBeansPersistentTimer-4.0 and basic FAT

Issue #13663: EJB Persistent Timer feature for Jakarta

Add enterpriseBeansPersistentTimer-4.0 and basic FAT
